ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot about Africa without much prior knowledge
At the end of this course, I became aware of all the most important monographs on Africa's environmental history.

I developed significant insight into the field of African environmental history. Through this course, I am now able to engage more seriously in critical evaluation of works on environmental history, especially in relation to my own interest in Northeast Africa and the Horn of Africa.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I felt like the readings could be rather redundant at times so conversation was as well. I enjoyed the fact that everyone participated quite a lot
This course was well facilitated to elicit responses and discussions from students. The professor also showed documentaries to give a pictorial view of the issues discussed. This was very helpful.
Strengths Very interesting material. Engaged Professor. Easily Managed Workload Weakness Too small class size.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. The environmental history of Africa is barely known. This course, therefore, fills that gap. We read virtually all the important literature on Africa's environmental history.

Absolutely, Professor Harms is a wonderful educator. The course was stimulating and I looked forward to the class every week. Whether a student it interested in environmental history or solely African history, this course is worth taking.
